meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unforgiving.
meanings.sent1: Her unforgivingnesses towards her friend's mistake caused a rift in their relationship.
meanings.sent2: The unforgivingnesses of the judge made the defendant fear the worst.
meanings.sent3: The unforgivingnesses of the teacher's red pen left no room for errors.
meanings.sent4: The unforgivingnesses of time never allowed for second chances.
meanings.sent5: The unforgivingnesses of the winter storm left the town buried in snow.

meanings.sent1: The unforgivingnesses of the dictator led to harsh punishments for dissenters.
meanings.sent2: His unforgivingnesses towards his ex-partner made reconciliation impossible.
meanings.sent3: The unforgivingnesses of the vending machine kept swallowing coins without dispensing snacks.
meanings.sent4: The unforgivingnesses of the ocean waves battered the ship relentlessly.
meanings.sent5: The unforgivingnesses of the desert sun left travelers parched and weary.
